plugins.name: Convert To RTL (Heb + Arb)
plugins.description:
* Update *

Now that Figma supports RTL will flip the text AND also update the text box to support RTL, so next time you will be able to write RTL properly.

Watch demo -> here.


This plugin converts flipped text that contains Hebrew & Arabic letters to RTL.


Arabic support still in testing. Let me know if you find bugs :)


How to use:

  1. Select an object (Frame/Component/Instance/Group/Text) that contains text with Hebrew letters
  2. Run the plugin
  3. The text boxes inside the selected object will be updated


Important notes:

  • The plugin does not support texts will multiple styles
  • This plugin opens a ui window and closes it after it's done converting all the text


Feel free to contact me for any bugs you find.
plugins.tagline: Converts texts to RTL

plugins.name: (Free) FigJam Dark Mode
plugins.description:
This plugin creates a black transparent background that is bigger than your Figjam board. It is then locked so you can work regularly on-top of it, simulating a dark mode background.


Note: If your content appears behind the dark mode effect, please right-click your content and 'Move to front'!


To remove this effect, you can do any one of the following:

  1. Use 'Undo' (Cmd+Z / Ctrl+Z).
  2. Unlock and delete the large background shapes created by the plugin.
  3. Restore your file using Version History (before the plugin was applied).


This plugin is open-source. Contributions are welcome!

https://github.com/Connagh/figjam-dark-mode/
plugins.tagline: Add a dark background to your FigJam boards!

plugins.name: Sankey Diagram : Chart made easy
plugins.description:
Captain Sankey for Figma is the ultimate solution for effortlessly creating Sankey diagrams within the Figma design environment.


‚òï Buy Us a Coffee


Whether you're a data visualization enthusiast, a designer, or a professional seeking an intuitive and powerful tool, this plugin empowers you to craft insightful Sankey diagrams with ease.


Key Features:

  1. Create with data: Captain Sankey enables you to create Sankey diagrams from scratch within your Figma workspace. Start with a blank canvas or edit sample diagrams to suit your requirements.
  2. Import CSV Import node weights and colors via CSV files to streamline the diagram creation process. Effortlessly incorporate your data into the visualization.
  3. Orientation Options: Captain Sankey offers flexibility in orientation. Create Sankey diagrams either vertically or horizontally, allowing you to adapt the visualization to your project's specific needs.
  4. Customization: Tailor your Sankey diagram to your exact specifications. Adjust node connections, set custom weights, and choose from a range of color options, including user-defined colors, random colors, or two-tone gradients.
  5. Advanced Settings: Dive deeper into advanced settings that provide finer control over the diagram. Customize labels, transitions, and other elements for precision and clarity.
  6. Well-Organized Artboard: The Sankey diagrams created using this plugin are structured in an organized Figma artboard. This thoughtful layout makes it easy to further customize and integrate your diagrams into your design projects seamlessly.
  7. Text Component: A dedicated text component is included for straightforward text manipulation within your Sankey diagram. Adding, editing, or styling text has never been more accessible.


‚òï Buy Us a Coffee: If "Sankey Diagram" has supercharged your design workflow and you'd like to show your support, consider buying us a coffee. Your support helps us keep "Sankey Diagram" free and continually improving.


‚òï Buy Us a Coffee


Captain Sankey for Figma is your trusted companion for crafting data-driven visualizations and communicating complex concepts in a visually engaging manner. Your feedback is valuable as we continuously enhance this tool to meet your design and data visualization needs.


With Captain Sankey, your data storytelling just became a whole lot easier, intuitive, and visually impactful.

plugins.name: MonoMagic: Desaturate Frames & Vectors
plugins.description:
True Desaturate Colors Plugin for Figma

The "True Desaturate Colors" plugin for Figma is designed for genuine color desaturation, ensuring that your designs aren't just overlaid with a grayscale mask but are genuinely converted to grayscale. All hues and saturations within a selected frame or group are authentically stripped, retaining only their brightness values. Whether you're checking contrast, crafting wireframes, or seeking a monochrome aesthetic, this plugin offers a genuine desaturation experience, streamlining your design workflow.


Features:

  1. Authentic Desaturation: Experience true color conversion to grayscale, devoid of overlay tricks.
  2. Gradient Support: Transforms both solid colors and intricate gradients into their genuine grayscale counterparts.
  3. Selective Application: Desaturate specific frames or groups, providing complete control over your design elements.
  4. User-Friendly: Seamlessly integrates with Figma, offering intuitive controls for designers.


Use Cases:

  • Contrast Analysis: Assess your design in true grayscale to ensure elements have the desired contrast.
  • Wireframing: Convert vibrant designs into genuine grayscale wireframes for clarity.
  • Monochrome Design: Achieve an authentic monochrome look for design projects.
plugins.tagline: Genuine Grayscale, No Overlays

plugins.name: AssetSheet
plugins.description:
With AssetSheet, you can easily create a sheet of all selected components on the current page. Sync those sheets to Zeplin or any other inspection tool to give developers access to all assets they need nicely organized in a single frame.

How to use it

1. Go to the page you want to create a sheet for
Activate Asset Sheet
2. Set element and frame padding
3. Create the sheet (You can either create a sheet from a selection of components or all components on the page)

Features

‚úÖ Organize all components in a single Frame
‚úÖ Either create the sheet from component instances or master components
‚úÖ Automatically create slices for each end every component
‚úÖ Works with different sized components
‚úÖ Adjust the spacing between elements and frame padding

plugins.name: CSS Variables
plugins.description:
CSS Variables


Import

  • Variables can be imported into Figma either as a new collection or existing collection can be updated.
  • Almost all the CSS color units are supported.
  • Only px, in, cm, mm, pt, pc and rem length units are supported. And for the rem unit, the default font size 16px is used for conversion.
  • The variables other than color and length units are silently ignored.


Export

  • Multiple modes can be exported at once from Figma.
  • The color units can be exported in one of the following spaces, sRGB(hex, rgb, hsl, hwb), CIELAB(lab, lch), Oklab, Oklch, display-p3.
  • Number unit can be exported either as pixel(px) or rem.
  • Also there's an option to preserve the alias.

accepted.name: mohan vadivel
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: A utility tool for importing and exporting variables between CSS and Figma.

plugins.name: Theme Switcher
plugins.description:
Are you looking for a plugin that lets you quickly switch between multi-branded style sheets, improves your workflow, and reduces work-time by 25%? Then look no further and install Theme Switcher today.


üîÄ Switch between multiple style sets in three clicks

üîÅ Sync from Local Style in a single click

‚úÖ Single click Color Theme application

üö´ No need to login to separate platform to manage styles


How does it work? ü§î


Create a new Figma file and create local styles within the file using "+" to add new colour styles.


Name your style using one of the example naming conventions mentioned below:


Option 1

‚ñ™Ô∏è First, setup Default (brand) Ex: Primary-1, Primary-2, Primary-3..., Text, Feedback.

‚ñ™Ô∏è Then, set up other brands Ex: Brand2/Primary-1, Brand2/Primary-2, Brand2/Secondary-1, Brand2/Text


*if there is only one colour style, you don't need to add - number ex: Brands/Feedback


Option 2

‚ñ™Ô∏è First, setup Default (brand) Ex: Default (Brand or Theme name)/ Primary-1/Colour Name, Default/Text (for the single parameter)

‚ñ™Ô∏è Then, Setup Other brands, ex: Brand2/Primary-1/Colour Name, Brand2/Text (for the single parameter)


3. Select Page or Frame to apply theme.


Here is the demo video to learn more about the plugin usage and how you can create the local styles.


It's open-source and we are welcome any suggestions, commits or issues discussion in GitHub.

plugins.name: ResponsiveScreenshot
plugins.description:
ResponsiveScreenShot is a Figma plugin that allows you to easily capture screenshots of responsive webpages on multiple devices simultaneously. Simply provide a URL and select up to three devices to capture the screenshots at once.



Features:

  1. Capture the exact view of a webpage by providing a URL.
  2. Specify up to three devices for simultaneous captures.
  3. Customize device dimensions for more precise captures.


Instructions:

  1. Open the plugin and enter the URL of the webpage you want to capture.
  2. Set up devices or customize screen dimensions as needed.
  3. Click the "Take Screenshots" button to capture the screenshots.
  4. Enjoy!


Limitations:

  1. Please ensure the URL is valid.
  2. Some pop-ups or banners on a webpage might appear in the screenshot.
  3. Webpages that require authentication or login cannot be captured successfully and may redirect to the login page.
  4. For webpages that include videos or animations, the captured screenshot may show a blank area in place of the video.


Feedback or bug report:

email: kevinshiuan.work@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots of a responsive webpage with URL on specified devices at once.

plugins.name: Prototype Quick Link
plugins.description:
This is a plugin that provides an easy way to copy a Prototype link to specific frames to the clipboard without having to switch to the Presentation mode.


How To Use

Select layers and run the 'Copy prototype link' command, and the link will be copied to the clipboard. You can also select and copy links to multiple selected Frames. In this case, each link will start with the name of its Frame.


Demo Video

link to the file (gif)


First Setup

The plugin must know the File Key to be able to create a prototype link. But this Key is private and it is only accessible to plugins published internally to a company that is on an Organization plan. So to make the plugin work you need to insert this File Key manually on first start of the plugin.


Set the File Key

  1. Click the 'Share' button on the top panel and click the 'Copy link'. Or you also can copy the whole File URL from the browser's address bar. The File URL looks like: https://figma.com/file/e9z7p5lisUPmRe9z7p5lisUPm/FileName
  2. Go to: Plugins -> Prototype Quick Link -> Settings
  3. Paste the copied URL to the input field and the plugin will extract the File Key automatically. You also can paste only the File Key to the input field.
  4. Done! Click 'Save' and use the plugin


Info: Your file share link is not sent to any external server.


Support

Plugin creation fueled by coffee ‚Äî buy me a cuppa.

accepted.name: Max Martynov
accepted.description: Web & Mobile Developer (JavaScript / Vue / Flutter / Ionic / Node)

plugins.tagline: Copy a Prototype link without switching to the Presentation mode

plugins.name: autosizetext
plugins.description:
When triggered this plugin autosizes text to fit within its textbox. If text it too small it will grow to fit the bounds or if text it too big it will shrink to fit the bounds.


This plugin has three different options to select textboxes to resize.


Full Page- Resizes all textboxes on current page

Selection - Resizes currently selected textboxes

Textbox Names - comma seperated list of textbox names to resize (ex. textbox1,textbox2 with resize textboxes that have names textbox1 and textbox2)


Visit github for more information on how to use the plugin, how to report issues, and how to suggest further improvements.

plugins.name: TokenOS [BETA]
plugins.description:
The TokenOS Figma Plugin is a powerful tool designed to streamline the process of managing design tokens within Figma. It allows you to create, edit, and manage tokens directly in your design files, and extends your workflow to incorporate external tools and platforms for an enhanced token management experience.


Features


Import JSON Tokens

The ability to import design tokens directly from a JSON file offers a versatile and efficient way of managing your tokens. This feature enables you to easily transfer tokens between different platforms or import from other design systems, promoting more collaborative and flexible design workflows. Moreover, if you have an existing token set in a JSON format, you can swiftly migrate it into Figma with this feature, saving time and effort.


Airtable Integration

One of the groundbreaking features of the TokenOS Figma Plugin is its seamless integration with Airtable. This integration allows you to manage, edit, and organize your design tokens in a more structured and data-driven manner using Airtable's user-friendly interface. You can create or modify tokens in Airtable, and then directly import them back into Figma. This integration fosters a more dynamic and flexible approach to managing complex design token systems.


How to Use

Accessing these features is straightforward once you've updated to the latest version of the TokenOS plugin. Inside Figma, open the TokenOS plugin interface and choose the 'Import from JSON' option to upload a JSON file containing your design tokens.

For the Airtable integration, you will first need to export your tokens to Airtable using our dedicated Airtable app. Once your tokens are set up and managed in Airtable, you can import them back into Figma using the plugin.


Airtable Extension: GitHub Repository


If you have an issue to report, go to this link

accepted.name: Martin Molcrette
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer

plugins.tagline: Streamlining Design Token Management. Easily import/export design tokens between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Image injector
plugins.description:
Batch fill layers with JPGs, PNGs or WEBPs from a folder.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Select the layers you want to fill.
  3. Select the image folder.
  4. Inject images.


Applicable layer types include

  1. Components / instances
  2. Frames
  3. Shapes
  4. Vectors


Customisable settings

  • Insert images into layers in the order of their names, their layer order, their position or randomly.
  • Insert image files according to their file names, or in a random sequence.
  • Include images found in the subfolders of the chosen folder.
  • Resize layers according to the relative image width or height so that images are not cropped.
  • Loop through images until all layers are filled, or only fill as many layers as there are images.
  • Insert images above or below all other fills, or remove all existing fills.


More in the future...
plugins.tagline: Batch fill layers with JPGs, PNGs or WEBPs from a folder

47586.name: Image injector
47586.description:
Batch fill layers with JPGs, PNGs or WEBPs from a folder.


How it works

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Select the layers you want to fill.
  3. Select the image folder.
  4. Inject images.


Applicable layer types include

  1. Components / instances
  2. Frames
  3. Shapes
  4. Vectors


Customisable settings

  • Insert images into layers in the order of their names, their layer order, their position or randomly.
  • Insert image files according to their file names, or in a random sequence.
  • Include images found in the subfolders of the chosen folder.
  • Resize layers according to the relative image width or height so that images are not cropped.
  • Loop through images until all layers are filled, or only fill as many layers as there are images.
  • Insert images above or below all other fills, or remove all existing fills.


More in the future...
47586.tagline: Batch fill layers with JPGs, PNGs or WEBPs from a folder

plugins.name: Spreadsheet to Sticky
plugins.description:
Spreadsheet to Sticky is a simple plugin on Figma that generate post its based on rows and columns on a spreadsheet (.xlsx or .xls from Google Sheets or Excel).


With this tool, you can:

  1. Generate Sticky from qualitative feedback from a column.
  2. Visually sort generated feedback via scores (e.g CSAT, NPS), through variables tagged onto each Sticky.
  3. Reverse search from feedback to reveal scores.
  4. Now supports all languages!
  5. Now generates Figjam supported Sticky Notes.


Spreadsheet to Sticky is meant to help Designers and Product Managers reduce the time needed to synthesise and organise qualitative research data from large surveys, when producing research reports. I'm using it personally and I hope it helps you all too.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Locate .xlsx or .xls file on plugin.
  3. Check conditions (remove empty, add tags etc).
  4. Generate Post-Its.


by Yuan Jie

accepted.name: Yuan Jie
accepted.description:
Product Designer/Developer

Making simple tools to help designers design more efficiently. In particular, tools to help visualise big amount of data.

plugins.tagline: Spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel) data to Sticky Notes, along with custom variables.

plugins.name: Guides inspector
plugins.description:
The Guides inspector is complete control over the guides!

‚úÖ You can:
- Create / Delete guides.
- Copy / Paste guides of the frame.
- Generate grids from guides.
- Create guide templates for later use.
- Adjust the position of the guides with high accuracy.

‚ö† Changes on the canvas are sometimes displayed only after you hover over it. This bug should be fixed soon.

About the Create Guides window:
‚ö† To get into it, you need to click on the name of the frame.

1. The Margin parameter is specified in the following order: margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, margin-left.

2. Some parameters support the "auto" value. 

It can be used, for example, to center the columns by setting the margin-left and margin-right parameters to "auto".
If you specify it only for margin-left, and margin-right set to 0, then the columns will be pressed to the right edge.

‚ö† When applying the template, - if its parameters are not suitable for the selected frame, - they will be adjusted.

For example, if the template contains 10 columns with a width of 100px, and the frame has a width of only 500px, then the number of columns will be reduced to 5.

___
A demo video with an example of usage can be found here: producthunt.com/posts/guides-inspector-figma-plugin

accepted.description: Digital designer. I love the design, the code and the cock crow in the morning :) Freelancer.

plugins.name: HSL Color picker - (Hue, saturation, lightness)
plugins.description:
Hue: Think of it as the base color on the rainbow wheel. This dial lets you pick your main color, from fiery reds to calming blues.


Saturation: Imagine dipping your chosen hue in a bucket of color. With the saturation slider, you control how vibrant and intense the color is. Less saturation gives you a soft, pastel vibe, while cranking it up results in a bold, saturated look.


Lightness: Picture adjusting the brightness of a scene. Lightness lets you move your color up and down the scale, from dark and dramatic to light and airy.
